items.sentence: Didn\'t you know that I didn\'t want Tom to do that?
Tom stopped talking when he saw Mary enter the room.
We need to make sure that Tom doesn\'t hurt himself.
We probably won\'t do that again until next October.
Tom checked his phone to see if Mary had texted him.
Tom almost drowned in his neighbor\'s swimming pool.
There\'s nothing on television that I want to watch.
I wouldn\'t mind waiting just a little while longer.
Tom came into the kitchen carrying two grocery bags.
Tom spent all afternoon wrapping Christmas presents.
Tom struggled to keep up with the rest of the class.
We need to come up with a better plan than this one.
Tom hadn\'t planned on going back to Boston so soon.
Tom noticed Mary didn\'t seem to be having much fun.
It might be more difficult than you think it\'ll be.
It\'s become very difficult for me to walk very far.
Do you think Tom would enjoy playing tennis with us?
Do you think Tom would like to go to Boston with us?
Does that seem like something you might want to try?
Tom quickly discovered that Mary\'s accent was fake.
Tom had to share a bedroom with his younger brother.
Tom has a brother who can probably help you do that.
Tom usually accomplishes whatever he sets out to do.
Tom wanted Mary to play a song for him on the piano.
I wish that we didn\'t have to wait three more days.
I wish that you\'d stop calling me so late at night.
Tom was mad because Mary went to Boston without him.
My father threatened to wash my mouth out with soap.
What\'s the name of the store where you bought that?
I knew that you\'d want to go to Australia with Tom.
I know Tom isn\'t planning to go to Boston with you.
Can you tell us what happened at school last Monday?
The bus driver was the only one who wasn\'t injured.
Tom wasn\'t with us the last time we came to Boston.
We\'d like to spend about three months in Australia.
Right now, all I want to do is get something to eat.
Tom knew Mary was going to be in the office all day.
I still think that it\'s unlikely that Tom will win.
I forgot to tell Tom I wasn\'t planning to be there.
Maybe I shouldn\'t have gone there so late at night.
I\'m going on a picnic with my friends next weekend.
I\'ve got to go to the office for a few hours today.
I\'ve gotten kind of used to doing things by myself.
Tom accepted the invitation to attend Mary\'s party.
Instead of going to Boston, I want to go to Chicago.
I didn\'t think Tom was going to be able to do that.
I don\'t believe I can walk that far in three hours.
I think that this tie will go great with that shirt.
I think that you were better looking with long hair.
It looks like Tom and Mary are going to get married.
